conclusion: Determine the electric field at point A using superposition and point charge formula.
Place the cube in a coordinate system with one vertex at the origin.
Charge 2q is at (0, 0, 0) and charge -q is at (L, L, L). Point A is at (L, 0, 0).
Calculate electric field at A due to 2q: E_2q = k(2q/L^2) i.
Distance from -q to A is L√3.
Calculate electric field at A due to -q: E_-q = k(-q/3L^2)(1/√3 i - 1/√3 j - 1/√3 k).
Sum the electric fields at A: E_A = E_2q + E_-q.
Calculate magnitude of electric field at A.
Final answer: magnitude of electric field at A.
